subject: Re: [junit] StackOverflowException using XMLEncoder
msgSnippet: Thanks Scott! When running the test w/ swingui the only output is a single line: java.lang.StackOverflowError - no line numbers or anything else. Just to see
messageBody:
Thanks Scott!
When running the test w/ swingui the only output is a single line:
java.lang.StackOverflowError - no line numbers or anything else.

Just to see what would happen I ran the test w/ the textui to my
surprise it worked! That should be OK since I'm going to be using ant
to automate builds/testing.

-Tom.

On Friday, April 23, 2004, at 06:14 AM, Stirling, Scott wrote:

>> From: S. T. Pimienta [mailto:stpimienta@...]
>>
>> Greetings, I am new to junit and this group. I wrote a test ( code
>> follows ) using XMLEncoder ( hence JVM >= 1.4 ) that bombs w/
>> StackOverflowException everytime. I ran the SAME code in my
>> classes'main method, w/o junit, and it works fine. I Googled
>> this but couldn't come up w/ anything. Should I just not to be
>> able to write objects out as .xml files w/ junit? What did I goof
>> up?
>
> Hi Tom,
>
> JUnit has a history of LinkageError and ClassCastException problems
> with XML APIs (see the JUnit FAQ). But I'm not familiar with a
> StackOverflowException being a problem. Your code looks fine, so it
> must be an interaction between JUnit and the JVM and/or its XML libs
> that causes it. Can you post the stack trace from the
> StackOverflowException?
>
> Thanks,
> Scott Stirling
> Workscape, Inc.
